contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = Wheatus | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Wheatus]] | Cover = Wheatus_Wheatus.jpg <!-- FAIR USE of Wheatus_Wheatus.jpg see image description page at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image:Wheatus_Wheatus.jpg for rationale --> | Released = August 15, 2000 | Recorded = 1999-2000 | Genre = [[Alternative rock]], [[pop punk]], [[power pop]] | Length = 33:15 | Label = [[Columbia Records|Columbia]] | Producer = Wheatus, Philip A. Jimenez | Last album = | This album = '''''Wheatus'''''<br />(2000) | Next album = ''[[Hand Over Your Loved Ones]]''<br />(2003)| }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r491724/review|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review]</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Wheatus''''' is the self-titled debut album by American alternative rock band [[Wheatus]]. The album was released on August 15, 2000. Three singles were released from the album - "[[Teenage Dirtbag]]," which reached number two on the [[UK Singles Chart]]; "[[A Little Respect]]", which peaked at #3; and a double A-side single of "Wannabe Gangstar" and "Leroy", which peaked at #22. The album makes two references to [[Iron Maiden]], and the single version of "Wannabe Gangstar" features Bruce Dickinson, their vocalist. A version of "Punk Ass Bitch" with different lyrics was used as the ending theme for ''[[Jackie Chan Adventures]]''. The album was certified gold in the UK. ==Track listing== All songs written by Brendan B. Brown, except where noted. # "Truffles" – 2:10 # "Sunshine" – 3:16 # "[[Teenage Dirtbag]]" – 4:07 # "[[A Little Respect]]" ([[Vince Clarke]], [[Andy Bell (singer)|Andy Bell]]) – 3:19 # "Hump'em N' Dump'em" – 3:38 # "Leroy" – 3:19 # "Hey, Mr. Brown" – 2:10 # "Love Is A Mutt From Hell" – 4:23 # "Punk Ass Bitch" (Rich Liegey) – 3:09 # "Wannabe Gangstar" – 3:45 ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" border="1" |- ! Year ! Chart ! Peak Position |- | 2000 | [[Australian Recording Industry Association|Australian ARIA Albums Chart]] | #55<ref>http://pandora.nla.gov.au/pan/23790/20020221-0000/www.aria.com.au/issue566.PDF</ref> |- |} ==Credits== * Brendan B. Brown - [[Singing| lead vocals]], [[electric guitar| electric]] and [[acoustic guitar]]s * Rich Liegey - [[bass guitar]], [[backing vocals]] * Pete Brown - [[Drum kit|drums]], [[backing vocals]], additional [[Percussion instrument|percussions]], [[turntables]] * Philip A. Jimenez - percussions, [[Keyboard instrument|keyboards]], [[sampler (musical instrument)|samples]] and [[harmonica]], [[turntables]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Wheatus}} [[Category:2000 debut albums]] [[Category:Wheatus albums]]
